Package com.mycompany.anothercam.Login

Class Verification

java.lang.Object
com.mycompany.anothercam.Login.Verification
public class Verification extends Object
Represents the Verification Object and the following assistance methods. A verification object can be called multiple times depending on the use cases Overall used in the CreateCamp functions and where scanner object is used
Since:
2023-10-28
Version:
1.0
Author:
Russel Tan Jun Hong

  • Constructor Details

    • Verification

      public Verification()

  • Method Details

    • setLoopTolerance

      public void setLoopTolerance(int loopTolerance)
      Changes the loop tolerance of the Verification Object
      Parameters:
      loopTolerance - This camp's new location should just be a regular string in general. The validation is already done before the method is called. This loopTolerance variable is used to loop an error validation until the user gets the values right. If the validation exceeds loopTolerance, exit the validation.

    • getLoopTolerance

      public int getLoopTolerance()
      Gets the loopTolerance count from the Verification Object.
      Returns:
      the loopTolerance count.

    • verifyScannerNumber

      public int verifyScannerNumber(Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the Number is valid.
      Parameters:
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      integer value if the Integer is successfully verified. -1 if the Integer is not valid.

    • verifyCampName

      public String verifyCampName(String campName, String questionAsked, Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the Camp Name is valid.
      Parameters:
      campName - takes in the campName of the camp to be added into the application
      questionAsked - takes in the question to be asked when entering the Camp Name.
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      boolean value of True if the Integer is successfully verified. False if the Integer is not valid.

    • verifyDate

      public int[] verifyDate(Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the Camp Date is valid.
      Parameters:
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      integer array of the date values. Return null if invalid values.

    • verifyCampLocation

      public String verifyCampLocation(String location, String questionAsked, Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the Camp Location is valid.
      Parameters:
      location - takes in the location of the camp to be added into the application.
      questionAsked - takes in the question to be asked when entering the Camp Name.
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      string of the location values. Return null if invalid values.

    • verifyTotalStudents

      public int verifyTotalStudents(int totalStudent, int totalCommittee, String questionAsked, Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the student attendee count is valid.
      Parameters:
      totalStudent - takes in the student attendee count of the camp to be added into the application.
      totalCommittee - takes in the camp committee member count
      questionAsked - takes in the question to be asked when entering the Camp Name.
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      integer of the student attendee count. Return -1 if invalid values.

    • verifyCampCommittee

      public int verifyCampCommittee(int inputCampCom, String questionAsked, Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the camp committee count is valid.
      Parameters:
      inputCampCom - takes in the camp committee count of the camp to be added into the application.
      questionAsked - takes in the question to be asked when entering the Camp Name.
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      integer of the camp committee count. Return -1 if invalid values.

    • verifyDescription

      public String verifyDescription(String description, String questionAsked, Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the camp description is valid.
      Parameters:
      description - takes in the description of the camp to be added into the application.
      questionAsked - takes in the question to be asked when entering the Camp Name.
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      string of the description. Return null if invalid values.

    • verifyToggleVisiblity

      public Camp.visibilityStatus verifyToggleVisiblity(int togVisible, String questionAsked, Scanner scanObj)
      Returns the verification status whether the camp toggle visibility is valid.
      Parameters:
      togVisible - takes in the visibility status of the camp to be added into the application. The value is either 1,2,3 which corresponds to the visibility enum.
      questionAsked - takes in the question to be asked when entering the Camp Name.
      scanObj - takes in the scanner Object for automated testing.
      Returns:
      visibility enumeration of the camp. Return No Visible enumeration if invalid values.
